channel.title: Captain's log on Vite & Rêves
channel.description: Recent content in Captain's log on Vite & Rêves

item.title: 2019-10-10 Front surfing
item.description: From: Agrapidia bay, Antipaxoi island, Greece To: Palaiokastrita (Alipa), Kerkyra (Corfu), Greece Our alarm sound of this morning was a gentle grating of our boat against the anchor chain of another boat.

item.title: 2019-10-09 Making water
item.description: From: Polis bay, Ithaki island, Greece To: Agrapidia bay, Antipaxoi island, Greece The wind turned 180 degrees at night. This almost always happens in bays when there’s not a lot of wind.

item.title: 2019-10-08 In Odysseus' footsteps
item.description: From: Agios Nikolaos, Zakynthos island, Greece To: Polis bay, Ithaki island, Greece On a boat, every day you wake up with different sounds. Sometimes it’s the gentle lapping of waves on the hull.

item.title: 2019-10-07 Thunderstuck
item.description: At: Agios Nikolaos, Zakynthos island, Greece We got stuck in Agios Nikolaos. There were thunderstorms all around us all day long. It rained. There was no wind, but the swell kept building up throughout the day, whipped up by faraway thunderstorms.

item.title: 2019-10-06 Shipwreck beach
item.description: From: Keri, Zakynthos island, Greece To: Agios Nikolaos, Zakynthos island, Greece No visit to Zakynthos would be complete without a stop at Shipwreck Beach. This beach, inaccessible from land, surrounded on three sides by 200 meter cliffs, must be the most photographed beach in the world.

item.title: 2019-10-05 A fast run
item.description: From: Katakolo, Western Peloponnesos, Greece To: Keri, Zakynthos island, Greece Good thing that there’s also something like a silence after the storm. Last night was quiet and we all had a good rest.

item.title: 2019-10-04 Deserted Katakolo
item.description: At: Katakolo, Western Peloponnesos, Greece This morning, around 6AM, we woke up with a bang. “Not again”, I groaned, thinking we had hit the quay, like in Hydra two weeks ago.

item.title: 2019-10-02 A bit of everything
item.description: From: Panagoula bay, Proti island, Greece To: Katakolo, Western Peloponnesos, Greece Be careful what you wish for, it may come true. Yesterday I wished for more wind.

item.title: 2019-10-02 On achieving calm
item.description: From: Pylos, Western Peloponnesos, Greece To: Panagoula bay, Proti island, Greece I woke up from the pitter-patter of little feet above my head — actually more like someone beating a very big drum, boats are loud that way — and stuck my head outside.

item.title: 2019-10-01 Tight sailing
item.description: From: Koroni, Western Peloponnesos, Greece To: Pylos, Western Peloponnesos, Greece After another rocking night in Koroni — the swell from Messiniakos bay comes into the harbor, where it gets reflected by the concrete quay, leading to a very confused wave pattern — we left for Pylos on the other side of the Peloponnesos pinky finger.

item.title: 2019-09-30 Koroni castle
item.description: At: Koroni, Western Peloponnesos, Greece Today we took another break from sailing. We have to wait here anyway until the wind turns in the right direction.

item.title: 2019-09-29 No time to waste
item.description: From: Geralimena, Southern Peloponnesos, Greece To: Koroni, Western Peloponnesos, Greece No wind at all this morning. Not one knot. So we visited Geralimena, the town that looked quaint, lovely and inviting the night before.

item.title: 2019-09-28 Wing on wing
item.description: From: Island Elafonisos, Southern Peloponnesos, Greece To: Geralimena, Southern Peloponnesos, Greece The morning promised a nice sailing day. 15 knots from the north, we needed to go west.

item.title: 2019-09-27 Rounding cape Maleas
item.description: From: Velanidia, Western Peloponnesos, Greece To: Island Elafonisos, Southern Peloponnesos, Greece Here’s the thing with industrial little harbors: kids don’t mind it one bit. For them it’s just an oversized playground.

item.title: 2019-09-26 Uncooperative winds
item.description: From: Monemvasia, Western Peloponnesos, Greece To: Velanidia, Western Peloponnesos, Greece In the morning — well, around noon actually, but it still felt like morning — we left Monemvasia to sail south.

item.title: 2019-09-25 Medieval Monemvasia
item.description: At: Monemvasia, Western Peloponnesos, Greece Today, the weather was its usual Greek self again. Not a smidgen of thunderstorm in sight, only deep blue skies and a little breeze.

item.title: 2019-09-24 Gale sailing
item.description: From: Vlychada bay, Peloponnesos, Greece To: Monemvasia, Peloponnesos, Greece We left Vlychada bay around 10 in the morning. The wind was a nice 10 knots, and for a while, we were cruising with the wind on our beam, full sails out.

item.title: 2019-09-23 Relaxing at Vlychada Bay
item.description: At: Vlychada bay, Western Peloponnesos, Greece Vlychada bay is magnificent. About half a mile long and 300m wide, surrounded on three sides by steep mountains, with a half sand, half pebble beach, and most important for sailors: a sandy bottom.

item.title: 2019-09-22 No wind
item.description: From: Hydra, island Hydra, Greece To: Vlychada bay, Western Peloponnesos, Greece The wind was ok this morning. It had decreased during the night and the sea outside also looked less agitated.

item.title: 2019-09-21 Kissed the quay
item.description: At: Hydra, island Hydra, Greece At night, the wind picked up. A lot. A northern wind, and we were tied to the south side. Not good.

item.title: 2019-09-20 A fond farewell
item.description: From: Mandraki bay, island Hydra, Greece To: Hydra, island Hydra, Greece The wind didn’t shift during the night after all. It shifted during the morning when we were contemplating having breakfast.

item.title: 2019-09-19 Lazy line troubles
item.description: From: Lavrion Port, Greece To: Mandraki bay, island Hydra, Greece Some days are perfect sailing days. So was this one. 15 knots, downwind sailing, almost no waves.

item.title: 2019-09-18 Shopping and provisioning
item.description: From: Lavrion Olympic Marine, Greece To: Lavrion Port, Greece We wanted to be closer to the Lavrion shops and restaurants, so we moved Vite & Rêves to the town port.

item.title: 2019-09-17 Started in Lavrion
item.description: At: Lavrion Olympic Marine, Greece We’re getting ready to leave for our world trip. We took 5 small suitcases and 2 big ones of clothes and stuff, 3 kids and 2 Parents with us.

item.title: 2019-08-31 We have a boat!
item.description: We bought a boat and did a shake-down cruise in August. It was glorious!
